programme.desc: The Internazionali BNL d'Italia. Coverage of day one of the WTA 1000 and ATP 1000 tournament, a clay-court event held at Foro Italico in Rome. The women's first round takes centre stage today with the men not due to commence play until tomorrow, and it is the qualifiers, wild-card entrants and unseeded players who will get their campaigns underway. Sara Errani was the most prominent Italian in action at this stage 12 months ago, and she delighted the home crowd with a 4-6, 6-2, 6-1 victory over Amanda Anisimova.(n)

programme.title: Live IPL
programme.desc: Mumbai Indians v Gujarat Titans. Coverage of the T20 match from Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai. These two sides met just the once last season in a close game that saw the visitors win by just six runs. The Titans hit 168-6 in their innings with Sai Sudharsan top-scoring with 45 from 39 balls. In reply the Indians fell short as they could only reach 162-9 in their reply.(n)

programme.title: High Noon
programme.desc: A town marshal is torn between love and duty on his wedding day as he prepares for the arrival of a vengeful adversary on the midday train. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Grace Kelly, Lloyd Bridges and Lee Van Cleef.(n)

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: Death takes over the body of a recently deceased young man, and embarks on a mission to claim the life of a powerful media tycoon, but ends up falling in love with his daughter instead - leaving him on the horns of a dilemma. Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani.(n)

programme.title: The Hanging Sun
programme.desc: Fleeing from his ex-employer, John, a reluctant assassin, seeks refuge in an isolated village, where he is faced with events that test his conscience. Drama based on the Jo Nesbo novel, starring Alessandro Borghi, Jessica Brown Findlay, Peter Mullan and Charles Dance.(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Gerda Wegener unveils a portrait of her husband Einar dressed as a woman in 1920s Copenhagen. Einar realises that the woman in the painting is his true identity, and decides to become one of the first people to undergo sex reassignment surgery. Period drama based on David Ebershoff's novel inspired by the true story of artist Lili Elbe, starring Eddie Redmayne and an Oscar-winning Alicia Vikander.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.(n)

programme.title: Out of Africa
programme.desc: Fact-based romantic drama based on the life of writer Karen Blixen, who, after relocating from Denmark to a farm in Nairobi for a marriage of convenience, embarked on a passionate and ill-fated love affair with an idealistic British adventurer. Starring Meryl Streep, Robert Redford, Michael Kitchen, Klaus Maria Brandauer and Leslie Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Take Me High
programme.desc: A merchant banker is sent to Birmingham to put pressure on a small struggling restaurant. However, he falls in love with the owner and together they set about starting a new business venture. Musical comedy, starring Cliff Richard, Deborah Watling and George Cole.(n)

programme.title: Five Easy Pieces
programme.desc: An oil-rigger who has cut himself off from his cultured, middle-class roots reluctantly returns to his family home, with his pregnant girlfriend in tow, after receiving word that his father is dying. However, the homecoming turns into a failure, as the psychological journey has a lasting impact on himself and those closest to him. Drama, with Jack Nicholson, Karen Black, Susan Anspach and Ralph Waite.(n)

programme.desc: A concert pianist unhappily married to a mentally ill woman falls in love with a waitress. Director John M Stahl's drama, starring Charles Boyer and Irene Dunne.(n)

programme.desc: Following the assassination of her husband, President John F Kennedy, Jacqueline Kennedy battles with grief and trauma to regain her faith, console her children, and define JFK's legacy. Director Pablo Larrain's Bafta-winning drama, starring Natalie Portman, Peter Sarsgaard and Greta Gerwig. Mica Levi provided the Oscar-nominated score.(n)

programme.title: Lady Bird
programme.desc: Golden Globe-winning comic drama, written and directed by Greta Gerwig. Artistic California teenager Lady Bird expects much from life. However, the strained relationship with her mother and failing family finances keep clipping her wings, while early romance leads to heartache. Saoirse Ronan, Laurie Metcalf and Tracy Letts star.(n)

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: In 1976, Jamaica is dangerously divided across political lines and musician Bob Marley vows to quell the violence by performing at the Smile Jamaica Concert. Two days before the high-profile gig, gunmen break into the singer's home, shooting Bob, his wife Rita and manager Don Taylor. Everyone survives and Marley moves to London with his entourage to begin work on the LP Exodus under Island Records supremo Chris Blackwell. Biographical drama, starring Kingsley Ben-Adir, Lashana Lynch and James Norton.(n)

programme.title: To Olivia
programme.desc: In 1962, writer Roald Dahl and his movie star wife Patricia Neal have retreated to the English countryside to bring up their young family. Tragically, their lives are turned upside down by the death of their daughter, Olivia. As the couple struggle through the loss, their grief becomes a source of redemption and strength which changes their destiny. Drama, starring Hugh Bonneville, Keeley Hawes and in one of his final films, Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: All That Jazz
programme.desc: A womanising, drug-addled Broadway choreographer begins to crack under the strain of preparing a major show, while being haunted with visions of his impending mortality. Bob Fosse's musical, with Roy Scheider, Jessica Lange, Ann Reinking and Leland Palmer.(n)

programme.title: The Quiet Man
programme.desc: An American prizefighter retires after killing an opponent in the ring, and returns to his Irish roots in a village in Galway, where he falls for a local woman. Unfortunately, their romance is hampered by a conflict with her brother over a property matter. John Ford's Oscar-winning romantic comedy drama, starring John Wayne, Maureen O'Hara, Victor McLaglen, Barry Fitzgerald and Ward Bond.

programme.title: The Sons of Katie Elder
programme.desc: Four brothers are reunited at their mother's funeral and discover their father was swindled out of his farm and subsequently murdered. However, as they set about avenging his death and reclaiming his land, a crook frames them for killing the sheriff. Western, starring John Wayne, Dean Martin, Earl Holliman, Michael Anderson Jr, James Gregory, George Kennedy and Dennis Hopper.

programme.desc: Families discover the lure of the Old West as they settle in territories from Wyoming to Kansas during the 19th century. Western, starring Kevin Costner, who also co-wrote and directed, with Sienna Miller and Sam Worthington.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A teenager from Boston moves to a small conservative town, and discovers the council and a preacher have enforced a ban on loud music and dancing. He openly defies the harsh rules, revitalising the local youth and winning the heart of the reverend's daughter. Remake of the 1984 drama, with Kenny Wormald, Julianne Hough and Dennis Quaid.

programme.title: Ray
programme.desc: Biopic of soul singer Ray Charles, exploring his battle against racial bigotry, drug addiction and personal demons on his rise to stardom. Blind by the time he was seven, the musician flirted with several styles including gospel, jazz and country, and became known as one of the music industry's most innovative performers. Starring an Oscar-winning Jamie Foxx alongside Regina King and Kerry Washington.

programme.title: Funny Girl
programme.desc: Musical biopic of 1920s singer and comedienne Fanny Brice, who rose from poor beginnings in New York's slums to become an overnight star and the toast of Broadway. Her success, however, came at the price of a turbulent private life and an unhappy marriage to a gambler, who grew increasingly jealous of her fame. Starring an Oscar-winning Barbra Streisand, with Omar Sharif, Kay Medford and Walter Pidgeon.

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: A blind, hard-drinking war veteran pays a timid college student to accompany him on a weekend break in the big city, where he plans to make the most of life. However, the youngster is shocked to learn that at the end of their trip, his new friend plans to kill himself. Comedy drama, starring an Oscar-winning Al Pacino, Chris O'Donnell, Gabrielle Anwar and Philip Seymour Hoffman.

programme.title: Stand By Me
programme.desc: Four 12-year-old best friends embark on a life-changing adventure in the Oregon wilderness in search of a missing teenager's body, unaware of the trials and triumphs that await them. Rob Reiner's 1950s-set coming-of-age drama, based on a novella by Stephen King, starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Jerry O'Connell, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland and Richard Dreyfuss.

programme.title: Valentine's Day
programme.desc: Anthology of stories charting the romantic complications of various Los Angeles residents. Romantic comedy drama, with Ashton Kutcher, Jessica Alba, Jamie Foxx, Jennifer Garner and Julia Roberts.

Unable to reconcile her feelings for the dashing Sir Walter Raleigh with her duty to her country, the monarch engineers a romance between the courtier and one of her ladies-in-waiting. Historical drama sequel, with Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush and Samantha Morton.(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A rebellious, hip-swinging student from the city moves to a small religious community, where he instantly clashes with an old-school fire-and-brimstone preacher - who has banned dancing and rock 'n' roll because he considers them immoral. Drama, starring Kevin Bacon, Lori Singer, John Lithgow, Chris Penn, Dianne Wiest and Sarah Jessica Parker.(n)

programme.title: 8 Mile
programme.desc: A white rapper strives to make a name for himself on the music scene, but his deprived home life on a Detroit trailer park and romantic complications put a damper on his plans as he struggles to win over the crowds and earn the respect of his peers. Drama, starring Eminem, Kim Basinger, Mekhi Phifer and Brittany Murphy.(n)

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow.(n)

However, he takes advantage of the deluded actress, becoming her lover in a relationship where their mutual deceit ends in tragedy. Drama, with Gloria Swanson, William Holden and Eric von Stroheim.(n)

programme.title: Cries and Whispers
programme.desc: Agnes, a woman dying of cancer, is visited in her remote home by her two sisters. Ingmar Bergman's drama, starring Harriet Andersson, Liv Ullmann and Ingrid Thulin. In Swedish.(n)

programme.desc: Years before the sentient robots became arch enemies, Optimus Prime and Megatron were friends on their home planet of Cybertron. However, their feud changes the universe forever. programme.title: Star Trek: Insurrection
programme.desc: The crew of the Enterprise oppose the Federation's plans to depopulate a planet which seems to grant its inhabitants eternal life. Violence/flashing images.

programme.title: Star Trek: Nemesis
programme.desc: Galactic peace is at stake when an evil clone leads the Romulans against the Enterprise. Featuring Patrick Stewart and Tom Hardy. Violence/flashing images.

programme.title: Beethoven
programme.desc: When a stray St Bernard becomes the newest member of the Newton family, his owners have to ward off a pair of dastardly dog-nappers. Flashing images/stereo sound only.

programme.title: The Portable Door
programme.desc: Two interns discover that their bosses have been using modern corporate strategy to disrupt the magical world. Star-studded Sky Original with Christoph Waltz and Sam Neill.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Men in Black Film
programme.desc: It's time to protect the Earth from the scum of the universe as the Cinema List walks through how to join the Men in Black, learning from agents Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones and more.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
programme.desc: Admiral James T Kirk and the USS Enterprise are called on to intercept an alien craft heading for Earth. Sci-fi action with the late Leonard Nimoy. Flashing images.

programme.title: Star Trek II: The Wrath Of Khan
programme.desc: Captain Kirk leads his crew in a desperate battle against ruthless arch-nemesis Khan. Sci-fi adventure with the late Leonard Nimoy. Flashing images.

programme.title: Star Trek III: The Search For Spock
programme.desc: The crew of the Starship Enterprise steal their old ship and set out to free the trapped soul of Spock. Sci-fi sequel with WIlliam Shatner. Flashing images.

programme.title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home
programme.desc: Eco-friendly sci-fi with Kirk (William Shatner) and the crew of the Enterprise travelling back to 1980s San Francisco to save a pair of whales, and thus, the planet.

programme.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier
programme.desc: Captain Kirk and his crew are kidnapped by a renegade Vulcan in this sci-fi sequel, directed by William Shatner. With the late Leonard Nimoy. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country
programme.desc: The Enterprise crew's imminent peace with the Klingons, is threatened after Kirk and McCoy are framed for the Klingon leader's murder. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Star Trek Beyond

programme.title: Star Trek: Nemesis
programme.desc: Galactic peace is at stake when an evil clone leads the Romulans against the Enterprise. Featuring Patrick Stewart and Tom Hardy. Violence/flashing images.

programme.title: We're the Millers
programme.desc: Comedy starring Jennifer Aniston and Jason Sudeikis. In order to repay a debt to his drug supplier, small-time pot dealer David Clark agrees to smuggle a shipment of marijuana across the Mexican border. However, to carry out the deception, David recruits a stripper and two teenagers to pose as his family.

programme.title: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
programme.desc: Comedy starring Will Ferrell, John C Reilly and Sacha Baron Cohen. Nascar racing champion Ricky Bobby has all the trappings of a successful career: a glamorous wife, a luxury home and a fanatical fanbase. But when French driver Jean Girard threatens Ricky's dominance, he seems ill-equipped to meet the challenge.

programme.title: The Three Musketeers: Milady
programme.desc: Swashbuckling historical adventure sequel starring FranÃ§ois Civil, Vincent Cassel and Eva Green. After his love Constance is kidnapped, young musketeer D'Artagnan sets out to rescue her, aided by the mysterious spy Milady de Winter, who's recently broken out of prison. Meanwhile, Porthos, Aramis and Athos are on their own mission...

programme.title: Get Away
programme.desc: A family's holiday to a remote getaway takes a lethal turn when they discover the island they're on is inhabited by a serial killer. Director Steffen Haars' comedy horror, written by and starring Nick Frost, with Aisling Bea and Sebastian Croft.

programme.title: The Book of Clarence
programme.desc: Biblical comedy starring LaKeith Stanfield. In AD 33 Jerusalem, debt-ridden criminal Clarence, the ne'er-do-well atheist brother of apostle Thomas, decides to make some much-needed cash by posing as a new messiah. But learning the same "tricks" as Jesus Christ proves tougher than initially assumed.

programme.title: The Shamrock Spitfire
programme.desc: Co Dublin-born fighter pilot Brendan Finucane, known by his colleagues as Paddy, hones his skills in the RAF during the Second World War, eventually becoming the youngest wing commander in its history. Biographical drama, starring Shane O'Regan, Ryan O'Grady and Sophia Eleni.

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: Federal agent Aaron Falk returns to his drought-stricken home town after an absence of more than 20 years to attend the funeral of his childhood friend. But his arrival opens up a decades-old wound - the unsolved death of a teenage girl. Crime drama, starring Eric Bana and Genevieve O'Reilly.

programme.title: Jules
programme.desc: Residents of a small Pennsylvania town are disturbed when a UFO crashes into a back garden. Director Marc Turtletaub's comedy drama, starring Ben Kingsley, Harriet Harris and Jane Curtin.

programme.title: The Three Musketeers: Milady
programme.desc: Swashbuckling historical adventure sequel starring FranÃ§ois Civil, Vincent Cassel and Eva Green. After his love Constance is kidnapped, young musketeer D'Artagnan sets out to rescue her, aided by the mysterious spy Milady de Winter, who's recently broken out of prison. Meanwhile, Porthos, Aramis and Athos are on their own mission...

programme.title: 57 Seconds
programme.desc: Franklin, a blogger, scuppers an attack against tech guru Anton Burrell, and finds a ring that the pioneering genius dropped. The device gives its wearer the ability to travel 57 seconds into the past, so Franklin decides to use it to take revenge against the pharmaceutical company responsible for his sister's death. Thriller, starring Josh Hutcherson and Morgan Freeman.

programme.title: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
programme.desc: Comedy starring Will Ferrell, John C Reilly and Sacha Baron Cohen. Nascar racing champion Ricky Bobby has all the trappings of a successful career: a glamorous wife, a luxury home and a fanatical fanbase. But when French driver Jean Girard threatens Ricky's dominance, he seems ill-equipped to meet the challenge.

programme.title: Click
programme.desc: Fantasy comedy starring Adam Sandler, Kate Beckinsale and Christopher Walken. Architect Michael Newman's will to succeed at work has come at the expense of quality time with his beautiful wife and children. But then Michael comes into possession of a remote control that allows him to pause, rewind and fast-forward his life just as he pleases.

programme.title: The Meg
programme.desc: Action horror thriller starring Jason Statham and Li Bingbing. After failing to save the crew of an imperilled submarine, deep sea rescue diver Jonas Taylor is unfairly branded a drunk and a coward. Five years later, he spies an opportunity to prove everybody wrong when he is approached to aid a team of researchers in their fight against a giant prehistoric shark.

programme.title: Meg 2: The Trench
programme.desc: Underwater rescue expert Jonas Taylor leads a research team on an exploratory dive into the deepest depths of the ocean. However, a greedy mining operation threatens the team's safety and unleashes a school of voracious 75ft-long megalodon sharks. Director Ben Wheatley's comedy thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham and Cliff Curtis.

programme.desc: A family's holiday to a remote getaway takes a lethal turn when they discover the island they're on is inhabited by a serial killer. Director Steffen Haars' comedy horror, written by and starring Nick Frost, with Aisling Bea and Sebastian Croft.

programme.title: Ordinary Angels
programme.desc: Drama based on a true story, starring Hilary Swank and Alan Ritchson. A struggling hairdresser in small-town Kentucky finds purpose by putting her energies into helping a widowed father get the funds to provide a liver transplant for his youngest daughter.

programme.title: Sweethearts
programme.desc: Two college freshmen break up with their high school sweethearts during one chaotic night before Thanksgiving. Comedy, starring Kiernan Shipka, Nico Hiraga, Christine Taylor and Jason Babinsky.

programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Kate Winslet. As the Second World War rages, American fashion model-turned-photographer Elizabeth "Lee" Miller defies the expectations of the era and travels to mainland Europe as a war correspondent for Vogue. Reporting from the frontline, Miller captures indelible images of the conflict, including the horrors found in the Nazi concentration camps at Buchenwald and Dac

programme.title: Monkey Man
programme.desc: Action thriller directed by and starring Dev Patel. A nameless young man known only as Kid makes his living as a masked participant at a seedy underground fight club where he is beaten up regularly. But there is method in his madness, as he works toward exacting revenge against those responsible for his traumatic past.

programme.desc: Rachel Chu is happy to accompany her longtime boyfriend, Nick, to his best friend's wedding in Singapore. She's also surprised to learn that Nick's family is extremely wealthy and he's considered one of the country's most eligible bachelors.

programme.desc: A man's (Hugh Grant) life changes when an international star (Julia Roberts) walks into his bookshop.

programme.title: This Means War
programme.desc: Once inseparable pals and partners, two CIA agents (Chris Pine, Tom Hardy) turn their deadly skills and an array of high-tech gadgetry against each other after both fall for the same woman (Reese Witherspoon).

programme.title: Disobedience
programme.desc: Photographer Ronit Krushka returns to the London community that shunned her decades earlier for her childhood attraction to a female friend. Their happy reunion soon reignites their burning passion as they explore boundaries of faith and sexuality.

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: Zoo animals (Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer) must learn to survive in the wild after they wash ashore on an exotic island.

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo
programme.desc: A widower (Matt Damon) relocates his family to a dilapidated zoo and, with the help of its eclectic staff, works to restore the facility to its former glory.

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: Deadshot (Will Smith), Harley Quinn (Margot Robbie), Captain Boomerang, Killer Croc and other armed supervillains unite to battle a mysterious and powerful entity, while the diabolical Joker (Jared Leto) launches an evil agenda of his own.

programme.title: Your Monster
programme.desc: A soft-spoken actress finds her voice again when she meets a terrifying but weirdly charming monster that lives in her closet.

programme.title: The Righteous Gemstones
programme.desc: Following three generations of a famous televangelist family with a tradition of charitable work, deviance and greed.

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo
programme.desc: A widower (Matt Damon) relocates his family to a dilapidated zoo and, with the help of its eclectic staff, works to restore the facility to its former glory.

programme.title: Live: Mel Brooks Live at the Geffen
programme.desc: The director/comic takes the stage to perform jokes, songs and anecdotes culled from 63 years in comedy.

programme.title: Marmaduke
programme.desc: A super-sized Great Dane (Owen Wilson) helps his family adjust to their new lives in California while simultaneously trying to fit in with his new canine pals.

programme.title: Brian Banks
programme.desc: The true story of Brian Banks, a high school football player who faces prison for a crime he didn't commit. Years later, with the support of the California Innocence Project, Banks fights to reclaim his life and fulfill his dreams of NFL stardom.

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: After landing US Airways Flight 1549 in New York's Hudson River, Capt. Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger (Tom Hanks) faces an investigation that threatens to destroy his career and reputation.

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim
programme.desc: A sudden attack by Wulf, a ruthless Dunlending lord, forces Helm Hammerhand and his people to make a daring last stand in the ancient stronghold of the Hornburg. Finding herself in a desperate situation, Helm's daughter must lead the resistance.

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: After leaving her all-female island for the first time, Wonder Woman (Gal Gadot) discovers her full powers and true destiny while fighting alongside men in a war to end all wars.

programme.title: Stand Up & Shout: Songs From a Philly High School
programme.desc: Students at Philadelphia's Hill-Freedman World Academy work with local musicians to create an album of powerful, original songs that captures both the challenging times they're living in and the joy that music brings.

programme.title: Son of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Inspector Clouseau's old foe (Herbert Lom) hunts a missing princess with a clumsy gendarme (Roberto Benigni) who happens to be Clouseau's son.

programme.title: Megamind
programme.desc: An evil genius (Will Ferrell) must create a powerful new opponent after defeating his heroic nemesis leaves him without purpose.

programme.title: Spy Kids 3-D: Game Over
programme.desc: A boy tries to rescue his sister (Alexa Vega) inside a virtual-reality game created by a madman out to enslave children.

programme.title: The Weight of the Nation for Kids
programme.desc: Students test their nutritional knowledge and learn how to live healthier lifestyles.

programme.title: The Emperor's Newest Clothes
programme.desc: A musical makeover of Hans Christian Andersen's classic tale about a vain ruler who lives in a kingdom where everyone agrees with him, and a child who reveals the truth that no one else is willing to say out loud.

programme.title: The Words That Built America
programme.desc: Filmmaker Alexandra Pelosi brings together over 100 people, including all of the living presidents and vice presidents, to read the Declaration of Independence, the United States Constitution and the Bill of Rights.

programme.title: What Happened on September 11
programme.desc: Personal stories, classroom scenes and interviews with educators, and archival news footage and photos are used to help a younger generation better understand the events of Sept. 11 and their continued effect on the world.

programme.title: Little Men
programme.desc: Two teens develop a growing friendship in Brooklyn, N.Y., while the feud between their respective parents (Greg Kinnear, Jennifer Ehle) continues to escalate.

programme.title: Iris
programme.desc: Filmmaker Albert Maysles pays tribute to nonagenarian Iris Apfel, the quick-witted, longtime interior designer and outspoken champion of eclectic fashion.

programme.title: Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: Malcolm Turner (Martin Lawrence) and his stepson (Brandon T. Jackson) go under cover at a girls school of the performing arts to flush out a killer.

programme.title: Mom and Dad Save the World
programme.desc: The dastardly emperor (Jon Lovitz) of another planet beams up a station wagon with a California couple (Teri Garr, Jeffrey Jones) inside.

programme.title: The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency
programme.desc: Precious Ramotswe launches Botswana's first female-run detective agency; Precious investigates cases including a missing boy, a missing finger and a cheating husband.

programme.title: The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency
programme.desc: Precious investigates a dentist who has suspicious mood swings; Grace refuses to turn away paying clients.

programme.title: The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency
programme.desc: A young woman worries about her unusually fearful father; a doctor asks for an investigation into his patients' mysterious deaths.

programme.title: The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency
programme.desc: An American wants the agency's help in locating her son; Grace reveals a long-held secret.

programme.title: The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency
programme.desc: A store owner wants Precious to find out if his daughter has a secret boyfriend; JLB uses a high-tech solution to help Precious with a case.

programme.title: The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency
programme.desc: Precious and Grace stave off competition from a rival agency; hired by a pageant promoter, Precious poses as a reporter and talks to beauty queens; Precious tails Nandira in search of her mysterious boyfriend.

programme.title: The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency
programme.desc: When a string of break-ins reaches the agency, Grace inspects the damage and recreates the crime; Precious receives an unnerving phone call; a suspicious jeweler comes under inestigation.

programme.title: Janet Planet
programme.desc: Enthralled by her own imagination, 11-year-old Lacy spends the long summer at home with her mother and three strangers.

programme.title: The Biggest Little Farm
programme.desc: A couple are followed through their successes and failures as they work to develop a sustainable farm on 200 acres outside of Los Angeles.

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Delving into the mythological, including dragons, mermaids, and unicorns -- alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals, and manatees; Stephen Fry travels far and wide to learn about such animals.

programme.title: Dolphin Tale 2

programme.title: Don't Divorce Me! Kids' Rules for Parents on Divorce
programme.desc: A group of children advise parents on helping families cope with divorce.

programme.title: Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted
programme.desc: On the run from a French animal-control officer (Frances McDormand), Alex (Ben Stiller) and friends (Chris Rock, David Schwimmer) hide out in a traveling circus, where they perform death-defying tricks and make some new friends.

programme.title: Justice League x Rwby: Super Heroes and Huntsmen Part One
programme.desc: Members of the Justice League are transported to the world of Remnant and find themselves turned into teenagers. The Remnant heroes combine forces with the Justice League to uncover why their planet has been mysteriously altered.

programme.title: The Nut Job

programme.title: When You Clean a Stranger's Home

programme.title: Red Tails

programme.title: Call Me by Your Name
programme.desc: In 1983 Italy, a precocious 17-year-old and a young doctoral student discover the heady beauty of awakening desire over the course of a summer that will alter their lives forever.

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: Though struggling with the ramifications of his extraordinary origin and abilities, young Clark Kent (Henry Cavill) must become a hero and save those he loves from a dire threat.

programme.title: School Life
programme.desc: Two inspiring teachers working at the only boarding school in Ireland for children ages 7 to 12 are followed for a year, as they begin to prepare for the end of their tenure.

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: Family tensions arise after a woman (Nia Vardalos) falls in love with a man (John Corbett) who is not Greek.

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
programme.desc: The adventures of writer Newt Scamander in New York's secret community of witches and wizards seventy years before Harry Potter reads his book in school.

programme.title: Casablanca
programme.desc: A cynical nightclub owner (Humphrey Bogart) protects an old flame (Ingrid Bergman) and her husband (Paul Henreid) from Nazis in Morocco.

programme.title: The Lionheart
programme.desc: In 2011, two-time Indianapolis 500 champion Dan Wheldon died in a horrific crash at the Las Vegas Motor Speedway, shaking the world of motorsports to its core. Ten years later, Dan's two sons, Sebastian and Oliver, follow in their father's footsteps.

programme.title: Look Into My Eyes
programme.desc: A group of New York City psychics conducts deeply intimate readings for their clients, revealing a kaleidoscope of loneliness, connection and healing.

programme.title: Woman in Gold
programme.desc: Maria Altmann (Helen Mirren), an elderly Jewish survivor of World War II, sues the Austrian government for the return of artwork the Nazis stole from her family.

programme.title: I Saw the TV Glow
programme.desc: A classmate introduces teenage Owen to a mysterious late-night TV show -- a vision of a supernatural world beneath their own. In the pale glow of the television, Owen's view of reality begins to crack.

programme.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
programme.desc: A 19th-century martial arts master (Chow Yun-Fat) gives a sword called Green Destiny to his beloved (Michelle Yeoh), then the two must recover it from female thieves.

programme.title: The Silence of the Lambs
programme.desc: An FBI trainee (Jodie Foster) seeks advice from a brilliant, psychopathic prisoner (Anthony Hopkins) to catch a killer who skins his victims.

programme.title: Hannibal
programme.desc: Seven years have passed since Dr. Hannibal Lecter (Anthony Hopkins) escaped from custody. The doctor is now at large in Europe. Mason Verger (Gary Oldman) remembers Lecter too, and is obsessed with revenge.

programme.title: Amityville: Where the Echo Lives
programme.desc: A paranormal investigator must confront a terrorizing dark entity that is haunting a beloved neighbor's home.

programme.title: Kicks
programme.desc: A 15-year-old (Jahking Guillory) recruits his two best friends (Christopher Meyer, Christopher Jordan Wallace) to help him retrieve his stolen Air Jordan sneakers from a neighborhood thug (Kofi Siriboe).

programme.title: In the Fade
programme.desc: Katja's life falls apart in the blink of an eye when two neo-Nazis kill her husband and 6-year-old son in a bomb attack. Her quest for justice soon pushes her to the edge as the two suspects stand trial for murder.

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: A Treasury agent (J.K. Simmons) closes in on a brilliant freelance accountant (Ben Affleck) who works for dangerous criminal organizations.

programme.title: Criminal
programme.desc: Hoping to stop a diabolical plot, the CIA implants the memories and skills of a dead agent (Ryan Reynolds) into the mind of a dangerous convict (Kevin Costner).

programme.title: Another Earth
programme.desc: Following her release from prison, a morose young woman (Brit Marling) seeks out the man (William Mapother) whose life she shattered in a car accident several years earlier.

programme.desc: Two male FBI agents (Shawn Wayans, Marlon Wayans) pose as female socialites to foil a kidnapping plot and save their jobs.

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: A man (Keegan-Michael Key) and his cousin (Jordan Peele) pose as ruthless gangsters to recover a stolen kitten.

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: A SWAT team ace (Keanu Reeves) must keep the speed of a Santa Monica bus above 50 mph, or a madman's (Dennis Hopper) bomb will explode.

programme.title: Mortdecai
programme.desc: Armed with only his good looks and special charm, an art dealer (Johnny Depp) travels the world to find a stolen painting that is rumored to contain the code to a bank account filled with Nazi gold.

programme.title: Another Earth
programme.desc: Following her release from prison, a morose young woman (Brit Marling) seeks out the man (William Mapother) whose life she shattered in a car accident several years earlier.

programme.title: Mystic Pizza
programme.desc: Three teenage girls (Julia Roberts, Annabeth Gish, Lili Taylor) come of age one summer working in a pizza parlor in Mystic, Conn.

programme.title: The Big Year
programme.desc: Three men (Steve Martin, Jack Black, Owen Wilson) race around North America in a prestigious contest to see who can spot the greatest number of bird species in a single year.

programme.title: Sixteen Candles
programme.desc: A girl turning 16 likes another girl's guy (Michael Schoeffling) and feels nobody cares about her birthday.

programme.title: Barbie
programme.desc: Barbie and Ken are having the time of their lives in the colorful and seemingly perfect world of Barbie Land. However, when they get a chance to go to the real world, they soon discover the joys and perils of living among humans.

programme.title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
programme.desc: Socially awkward Charlie is a wallflower watching from the sidelines, until a pair of charismatic seniors take him under their wing.

programme.title: Companion
programme.desc: A weekend getaway at a remote cabin turns to chaos when it's revealed that one of the guests -- a subservient android built for human companionship -- has gone haywire.

programme.title: Evil Dead Rise
programme.desc: A reunion between two estranged sisters gets cut short by the rise of flesh-possessing demons, thrusting them into a primal battle for survival as they face the most nightmarish version of family imaginable.

programme.title: Morbius
programme.desc: Dangerously ill with a rare blood disorder and determined to save others from the same fate, Dr. Morbius attempts a desperate gamble. While at first it seems to be a radical success, a darkness inside of him is soon unleashed.

programme.title: Elevation
programme.desc: Post-apocalyptic survivors find refuge in the Rocky Mountains to hide from giant, insect-like creatures that can't live above 8,000 feet. However, when one of them needs life-saving supplies, they risk it all to venture into the danger zone.

programme.title: Greenland
programme.desc: A family embarks on a perilous journey as a planet-killing comet hurtles toward Earth. As the countdown to the global apocalypse approaches zero, their incredible trek culminates in a desperate and last-minute flight to a possible safe haven.

programme.title: Funny People
programme.desc: A gravely ill comic (Adam Sandler) takes a struggling performer (Seth Rogen) under his wing, then gets a chance to re-evaluate his life when his disease goes into remission.

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: A teen (Asa Butterfield) discovers a secret refuge on an island where children have special powers and hidden enemies.

programme.title: Splice
programme.desc: An experiment goes horribly wrong when two scientists (Adrien Brody, Sarah Polley) use human DNA to create a hybrid creature.

programme.title: The Forger
programme.desc: An art forger (John Travolta) arranges an early release from prison so that he can spend time with his dying son, then must pull off one final job for the man who made his freedom possible.

programme.title: The Unbreakable Tatiana Suarez
programme.desc: A chronicle of the MMA fighter Tatiana Suarez as she returns to the sport after an injury forced a four-year hiatus; Suarez reflects on her journey from wrestling prodigy to professional athlete in the UFC and the legacy she leaves young women.

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim
programme.desc: A sudden attack by Wulf, a ruthless Dunlending lord, forces Helm Hammerhand and his people to make a daring last stand in the ancient stronghold of the Hornburg. Finding herself in a desperate situation, Helm's daughter must lead the resistance.

programme.title: Tuesday
programme.desc: A mother and her daughter must confront Death when it arrives in the form of an astonishing talking bird.

programme.title: We Live in Time
programme.desc: A surprise encounter brings together a couple, changing the course of their lives. Challenged by the limits of time, they learn to cherish each moment of their decade-spanning and movingly rare love story.

programme.title: Assassin's Creed
programme.desc: A descendant (Michael Fassbender) of the mysterious secret society known as the Assassins uses his newfound knowledge and physical skills to battle the power-hungry Templar Order.

programme.title: Joker
programme.desc: Isolated, bullied and disregarded by society, failed comedian Arthur Fleck begins a slow descent into madness as he transforms into the criminal mastermind known as the Joker.

programme.title: Joker: Folie Ã Deux
programme.desc: Struggling with his dual identity, failed comedian Arthur Fleck stumbles upon true love while incarcerated at Arkham State Hospital. Awaiting trial for the murder of five people, Fleck soon discovers the music that's always been inside him.

programme.title: Elevation
programme.desc: Post-apocalyptic survivors find refuge in the Rocky Mountains to hide from giant, insect-like creatures that can't live above 8,000 feet. However, when one of them needs life-saving supplies, they risk it all to venture into the danger zone.

programme.title: Greenland
programme.desc: A family embarks on a perilous journey as a planet-killing comet hurtles toward Earth. As the countdown to the global apocalypse approaches zero, their incredible trek culminates in a desperate and last-minute flight to a possible safe haven.

programme.title: Funny People
programme.desc: A gravely ill comic (Adam Sandler) takes a struggling performer (Seth Rogen) under his wing, then gets a chance to re-evaluate his life when his disease goes into remission.

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: A teen (Asa Butterfield) discovers a secret refuge on an island where children have special powers and hidden enemies.

programme.title: Splice
programme.desc: An experiment goes horribly wrong when two scientists (Adrien Brody, Sarah Polley) use human DNA to create a hybrid creature.
